intro: Vahea, commonly known as the "false hibiscus," is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plants typically have showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. They often grow as shrubs or small trees, with woody stems and palmately lobed leaves. Vahea species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
